intro: Dichapetalum ugandense, commonly known as the Uganda dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
